title: North Community Associates: A Scandal in Diamonds and Black Velvet—John Singer Sargent's Madame X
hero_caption: John Singer Sargent. Mrs. George Swinton (Elizabeth Ebsworth), 1897. The Art Institute of Chicago, Wirt D. Walker Collection.&nbsp;
description:
>John Singer Sargent took a calculated risk painting the likeness of the striking socialite Virginie Avegno. She had made her name as a "Professional Beauty" with a taste for revealing gowns and a liberal use of cosmetics. But when the painting debuted, the portrait ignited a scandal, bringing notoriety rather than fame to two ambitious Americans in Paris who found their reputations dangling on a single diamond strap. Location: Skokie Country Club at 500 Washington Ave., Glencoe, IL 60022
Speaker: Debra Mancoff
Program capacity: 150
Registration period: Thursday, August 16, 2018 – Thursday, August 30, 2018

>Schedule of the Day: 9:30Registration and Check-In9:30Breakfast10:15Lecture by Debra Mancoff
